thread.title: Boys Soccer: Ryan Vieira's shutout streak alive as Old Colony claims conference co-title
thread.title_full: Boys Soccer: Ryan Vieira's shutout streak alive as Old Colony claims conference co-title

author: Brendan Kurie bkurie@s-t.com
title: Boys Soccer: Ryan Vieira's shutout streak alive as Old Colony claims conference co-title
text: Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 11:11 PM By Brendan Kurie Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 11:11 PM Â» Social News How long exactly is disputed, but one thing is for sure: For the first time in at least a decade, the Old Colony boys soccer team has claimed a conference championship. The Cougars beat Norfolk Aggie 6-0 on the road on Wednesday to claim a co-championship with Upper Cape in the Mayflower Small Conference. "They're a really great group of kids," coach Sergio Pedrosa said. "They care about each other. There's zero issues. It helps that you have studs like Paul Soucy and Zach Soucy." Both Paul and Zach factored into Wednesday's win. Paul scored two goals, giving him 25 on the season, while Zach notched two assists. Zach Ronan scored twice and Joe Rose and Brenna Gray added goals. Assits came from Nathan Ashburn, Matt Rita, Rose and Gray. Keeper Ryan Vieira made five saves to notch his fourth consecutive shutout. He's gone 380 minutes, spanning five games, without allowing a goal. The Cougars host Southeastern on Tuesday as they build toward the postseason. "I have a feeling we'll do pretty well going forward," Pedrosa said. "These kids have the cohesion you need. Follow Brendan Kurie on Twitter @BrendanKurieSCT By Brendan Kurie
